units.name: BroadsideBattlesuit
units.description: Heavily armoured infantry unit with long range weaponry.
units.flavour: With deliberate strides, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits advance into optimum firing positions. Inside each of the heavily armoured battlesuits, holotargeting data dances across the retinas of the grim-faced pilot as he swings the suit's mighty guns towards the foe. Each Broadside is a walking gun battery, carrying either a twin-linked heavy rail rifle that can smash through Imperial power armour as though it were glass, or high-yield missile pods capable of wiping out swathes of enemy infantry in lethal explosions.

units.name: BuilderDrone
units.description: Drone unit that repairs units, clears tiles and founds new cities.
units.flavour: Tau Drones are small hovering AI machines that fulfil a large variety of support functions. Unlike the Imperiums AIs, which are very simple and heavily constrained following the Men of Iron rebellion, Tau AIs are intelligent and operate independently. Builder Drones are an Earth Caste flavour.

units.name: CadreFireblade
units.description: Hero unit that excels at empowering steady firing lines.
units.flavour: As the enemy surges closer, the Fireblade's courage steels his comrades, steadying the firing line and focussing the mind of every Fire Warrior present. Raising his pulse rifle and sighting down its length, the Cadre Fireblade calls out enemy weak spots and optimal firing solutions to his followers, watching the foe press closer with a practised eye. Only at the optimum moment does the Fireblade bark out the order to fire. At the Fireblade's command, the T'au gunline unleashes a storm of fire, an energised squall that tears the enemy to pieces with terrible efficiency.

units.name: Commander
units.description: Jet pack hero unit that coordinates T'au metastrategies.
units.flavour: The T'au Commander surges into battle in a blaze of firepower. Dynamic and determined, the Commander places every shot perfectly for maximum lethality. Veterans of hundreds of battles, each T'au Commander has the honour of piloting a battlesuit that represents the pinnacle of their race's military technology. The Commander's weapons are of the finest quality, often including special issue armaments that annihilate swathes of enemy infantry or tear battle tanks apart with a single shot.

units.name: CrisisBattlesuit
units.description: Versatile jet pack infantry unit with short range weapons.
units.flavour: Whether leaping into battle from low atmosphere or bounding toward the foe with their jump jets flaring, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits make for a truly inspiring sight. Heroes of the T'au Empire, these elite shasui have every high-tech weapon and support system at their disposal as they cut deep into the enemy lines with guns blazing. Salvoes of missiles and plasma fire tear heavy infantry to pieces and vaporise their armoured support. Gouts of superheated flame and whirring volleys of burst cannon fire sweep lesser enemies away like autumn leaves upon a gale.

units.name: Devilfish
units.description: Skimmer tank unit that can transport infantry.
units.flavour: Skimming swiftly across the battlefield, the TY7 Devilfish glides between smoking wrecks and blazing ruins, boosting over corpse-choked waterways and yawning ravines as it closes on its objective. A resilient and versatile transport, it is the Devilfish that affords the Fire caste the mobility they need to fight war in the T'au way. Formations of Devilfish bear Breacher Teams into the heart of the foe to execute the final stages of the Mont'ka strike. It is Devilfish that rapidly relocate Fire Warriors to new coordinates as part of each grand strategic manoeuvre, or punch through the enemy lines with guns blazing to extract Pathfinder Teams before they can be overwhelmed.

units.name: Ethereal
units.description: Support hero unit that heals and compels troops to excel.
units.flavour: Solemn and stern, members of the Ethereal caste direct their followers with a calm authority that cannot be denied. Each Ethereal moves in the eye of his own personal storm, an oasis of serenity amid the raging madness of war. Whether pacing steadily across the battlefield or borne upon the broad disc of a hover drone, the Ethereal issues measured commands to the T'au around him. Wherever his steady gaze alights, his followers fight harder than ever, compelled to excel in the eyes of one who utterly embodies the Greater Good.

units.name: FireWarrior
units.description: Basic versatile infantry unit.
units.flavour: The strobing flare of massed pulse fire announces the attack of a Fire Warrior Strike Team. Whether leaping from the hatch of a hovering Devilfish or drawn up in a resolute firing line, the warriors of a Strike Team maintain a constant blizzard of shots that cuts their foes to pieces. Howling pulse rifles, pulse carbines and tactical support turrets lay down a withering carpet of suppressing fire, while EMP grenades kick out shimmering shockwaves of electromagnetic force that leave enemy vehicles as cold, dead husks.

units.name: GhostkeelBattlesuit
units.description: Jet pack monstrous creature unit that provides concealment and debuffs enemies.
units.flavour: Ghostkeel Battlesuits lunge from the shadows to rake their prey with lethal volleys of fire. Wreathed in stealth fields projected by their hovering drones, the half-seen battlesuits move with terrifying speed for their size. One moment the enemy is advancing across the battlefield, the next looming killers are bounding through their midst with guns blazing. Panicked return fire flies wide, the Ghostkeels' attackers unable to draw a bead on their sensor-baffled targets.

units.name: GunDrone
units.description: Basic combat drone unit.
units.flavour: Mounting underslung twin linked pulse carbines, Gun Drones provide their controller with additional covering fire.

units.name: GravInhibitorDrone
units.description: Drone unit that prevents tile movement.
units.flavour: This Drone hovers protectively at its operator's shoulder, driving back the enemy with thrumming gravity waves.

units.name: HammerheadGunship
units.description: Skimmer tank unit with versatile weaponry.
units.flavour: Hammerhead Gunships glide into battle like predatory beasts. As they advance, their massive turret armaments traverse smoothly, railguns and ion cannons sweeping left and right as they hunt for targets. The moment a suitable victim presents itself, firing solutions are calculated in the blink of an eye. Power surges as gravitic stabilisers kick in with a bass hum and the Hammerheads loose the lethal fury of their arsenal upon the foe.

units.name: Headquarters
units.description: Headquarters unit that represents a city's defenses.
units.flavour: Named after the Air Castes continent-sized space stations, this fortress acts as the central point of the colony-city. It is theoretically the solitary preserve of the Commanders in a military situation, but in practice is the seat of the colonys Ethereals.

units.name: InterceptorDrone
units.description: Advanced anti-air drone unit.
units.flavour: The first thing an enemy fighter pilot learns about Interceptor Drones is when one pops out of the wing of a Sun Shark bomber and starts shooting. Given how lethal its twin-linked Ion Rifles are, its often also the last thing an enemy pilot sees.

units.name: KrootoxRider
units.description: Sneaky infantry unit with both ranged and close combat capabilities.
units.flavour: Surging from the undergrowth with their rifles blazing, the warriors of the Kroot Carnivore squads fall upon their victims with feral shrieks. In their midst lumber massive Krootoxes, gunners perched upon their backs as they direct sawing bursts of heavy fire into the foe.

units.name: MarkerDrone
units.description: Drone unit that marks enemies for increased damage.
units.flavour: Fitted with a markerlight and predictive tracking module, Marker Drones can paint targets and call in seeker missile strikes.

units.name: Pathfinder
units.description: Lightly armoured infantry unit with scouting capabilities and advanced drones.
units.flavour: No image epitomises the essence of the Greater Good quite like a courageous Pathfinder holding his markerlight's beam upon a distant, crucial target, even as his own position is overrun by the foe. Indeed, the entire mission of the Pathfinders is a strategic embodiment of the T'au'va, for their key role is not to engage the enemy in person, but to optimise the abilities of their comrades so that they can strike with maximum effectiveness. To this end, Pathfinders carry markerlights and are regularly accompanied by a variety of highly specialised Drones that serve as fire support and drop-beacons.

units.name: Piranha
units.description: Fast skimmer unit with anti-armour weaponry.
units.flavour: Sleek squadrons of TX4 Piranhas race across the battlefield, sweeping wide around the enemy flanks or punching through their midst in lightning-fast strafing runs. These agile craft have countless uses within the T'au military; their speed and heavy firepower allow them to serve in capacities as varied as armoured escort, reconnaissance in force, tank-hunting, flank attackers, supply-line raiding, mobile reserves or even, in extreme circumstances, sudden-strike assassinations.

units.name: PulseAcceleratorDrone
units.description: Drone unit that increases the range of allied pulse weapons.
units.flavour: The Pulse Accelerator Drone augments the pulse weaponry of its operator's squad, lending greater range to their fire.

units.name: ReconDrone
units.description: Combat drone unit with scouting capabilities.
units.flavour: The Recon Drone mounts an array of support systems to aid Pathfinder Teams in the field.

units.name: RiptideBattlesuit
units.description: Heavily armoured jet pack monstrous creature unit with excellent fire support and a multipurpose nova reactor.
units.flavour: Looming through the smoke and flames of the battlefield, XV104 Riptides are a truly terrifying sight. The teams' strides shake the ground, and their jump jets roar thunderously as they make long, dynamic bounds across the war zone. Foes quail in horror as the massive suits swings their heads in their direction, the pilots and their networked Als bringing their mighty arsenals to bear. With a rising whine, the Riptides' nova reactors power up, a momentary glow gathering around the battlesuits' jutting guns before they turn the world to fire and light.

units.name: RazorsharkStrikeFighter
units.description: Well-equipped flying fighter unit.
units.flavour: As the Razorshark begins its attack run, some foes spray fire into the skies in the hope of driving off their attacker. Others dash for cover, praying to their primitive deities for help that will not come. Neither course of action will save them. Hurtling down from the clouds, the lethal strike fighter rakes the enemy with a punishing salvo. Burst cannon rounds chew lines of carnage through the foe, bodies twitching and dancing as they are struck again and again. Seeker missiles scream down to punch through tank turrets and turn armoured transports into blazing pyres. Yet it is the rain of fire from the Razorshark's quad ion turret that is truly terrifying, the stream of high energy shots chopping the foe into glowing chunks or blasting them apart in a single, massive explosion of energy.

units.name: SkyRayGunship
units.description: Skimmer tank unit equipped with powerful missiles that excels in first strikes and against flyers.
units.flavour: While the Hammerhead is a dynamic hunter, its sister gunship the TX78 Sky Ray is a far more sinister killer. Mounting a complement of seeker missiles beneath its upswept ordnance racks, the Sky Ray typically lurks behind the main T'au advance, remaining mute and concealed until the moment comes to strike. The Sky Ray often fulfils a supporting role, and its ballistic arsenal can be called in by any T'au with a markerlight to carry out a remote strike on a sufficiently valuable target.

units.name: ShieldDrone
units.description: Drone unit that shields allies.
units.flavour: Projecting a powerful counter-ballistic force field, Shield Drones protect their operators from harm.

units.name: StealthBattlesuit
units.description: Jet pack infantry unit that specializes in infiltration and anti-armour.
units.flavour: For some foes, the only hint of danger is a slight sensor-ghost, or the unnerving feeling of being watched. For others there is no warning at all, before the world lights up with chattering burst cannons and hissing fusion blasters. Flickering out from amid their camouflage fields come the T'au Stealth Suits, their point-blank salvoes chopping enemy infantry to steaming offal and blowing their armoured vehicles sky high.

units.name: StealthDrone
units.description: Drone unit that conceals allies.
units.flavour: Some Drones are harder to produce than others. The MV5 Stealth Drone is one such, carrying a stealth field generator and only ever deployed in pairs alongside the rare XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuit. Given how long these infiltrators spend alone behind enemy lines, Ghostkeel pilots typically develop a strong relationship with their MV5s and Battlesuit.

units.name: ShieldedMissileDrone
units.description: Shielded combat drone unit.
units.flavour: The Shielded Missile Drone uses its cohesive energy field to absorb incoming shots, while its missiles arc out to destroy the foe.

units.name: Stormsurge
units.description: Gargantuan creature with phenomenal firepower that is equally lethal in attack and defence.
units.flavour: The earth shakes with the approach of the towering KV128 Stormsurge. Mag-lifted into battle by modified Manta Missile Destroyers, these titanic walking tanks serve as mobile strongpoints with enough firepower to obliterate entire formations of the foe. Once he has the enemy in his sights, the Stormsurge's pilot fires stabilising anchors, locking the enormous ballistic suit to the ground while the gunner diverts all power to its apocalyptic arsenal of weaponry.

units.name: TidewallGunrig
units.description: Heavily armed fortification that can be moved by transporting troops.
units.flavour: With its in-built rail weaponry, the Tidewall Gunrig provides the firepower to deal with heavy enemy assault units or advancing ranks of armour. Manned by hard-eyed Fire Warriors, these mobile turrets mount devastating railguns that are more than capable of ripping apart enemy tanks or monstrous beasts with volleys of hyper-sonic rounds.

units.name: SunSharkBomber
units.description: Flying bomber unit that auto-marks enemies for increased damage and deploys interceptor drones.
units.flavour: As the Sun Shark bomber soars into battle, its pulse bomb generator flares to life, the charge glowing brighter and brighter until it sears the eyes like a miniature star. Guided by holosuite targeters, the Sun Shark's pilot grimly holds his course through a hail of enemy flak, waiting to discharge his pulse bomb at the optimum moment. Even as the Sun Shark peels away into the clouds once more, a vast fireball engulfs the enemy below, the blazing flare erasing those who will not embrace the Greater Good.

buildings.name: Aircraft
buildings.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as increases population limit and generates influence.
buildings.flavour: The Air Castes slender limbs and hollow bones are so ill-suited to life on the ground that they are often called The Invisible Caste by planet-dwellers. Their nacelles are combined factories, hangars and living spacesthroughout holding technology that reduces the effects of Gladius Primes gravity on their delicate physiology.

buildings.name: Construction
buildings.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates ore, research and influence.
buildings.flavour: The Brachyuran might not be suited to combatafter all, they mostly closely resemble crustaceans similar to tiny Terran crabsbut their compact form conceals a fierce technical intelligence, ideally suited to delicate construction. In this foundry, teams of Brachyuran can aid the Earth Caste in building structures, from the macro to the micro level.

buildings.name: Energy
buildings.flavour: The Demiurg were the first to lend the Tau their expertise, but the Tau have also drawn upon the abandoned technology of the Imperium, refining it in their way. This strange structure reflects that mixed origin, showing Tau aesthetics imposed on an Imperial reactor cluster.

buildings.name: Food
buildings.flavour: Many races have joined the Tau, but not all have some unique skillset. The Greet are an aquatic race, undistinguished in most fields; all they can contribute to the Tau is their labour and knowledge of aquaculture in these sealed hydroponic farms.

buildings.name: Headquarters
buildings.flavour: Named after the Air Castes continent-sized space stations, this fortress acts as the central point of the colony-city. It is theoretically the solitary preserve of the Commanders in a military situation, but in practice is the seat of the colonys Ethereals.

buildings.name: Heroes
buildings.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates food and influence.
buildings.flavour: Commanders like ShadowSun and PureTide are rare individuals, raised up by the Ethereals to be representatives of all that is good and true about the Tau. So few are they that, when not deployed on campaigns, they are placed in stasis until the next time they are needed.

buildings.name: Housing
buildings.flavour: These sturdy housing units shelter the Taus greatest resourceits population of Tau and general workers. It is often the best-defended location next to the Etherealsbecause without workers and families to survive and rebuild, where is the worth in fighting?

buildings.name: Infantry
buildings.description: Building that produces infantry as well as increases population limit and generates influence.
buildings.flavour: In this smooth-skinned blister-bunker, Fireblades and other Tau veterans train up the members of the fire caste from Shassaal recruits into full-blown Shasla Fire Warriors, administering the Trial of Fire at the end of their fourth year.

buildings.name: Loyalty
buildings.flavour: This is a simple statue to AunVa, the Ethereal Supreme, showing him supporting the way, sculpted as a portal through which all the races of the galaxy flow. Embedded in its bone-white surface are a range of listening devices, to track the sentiment of the population and isolate dissident elements.

buildings.name: Influence
buildings.flavour: The Water Caste are diplomats-supremeable to talk round the most intransigent, alien species to the Taubut on hostile Gladius, their skills are best employed in this lean communications tower proselytising on all channels, attracting the remaining population to the cause.

buildings.name: Ore
buildings.flavour: A sturdy Xenos species, the Anthrazods normally spend their lives mining asteroids for the greater good. The shortage of manpowerand lack of asteroidson Gladius means theyre working more closely with the Earth Caste to extract and refine ore.

buildings.name: Research
buildings.flavour: The squat race that the Imperium knows as the Demiurg are called the wise-gifted ones or Bentusi by the Tau, for their mastery of advanced science and automation. They are normally a semi-allied space-bound race, but on Gladius they have been forced to the ground, where they dole out their advanced technology to the Tau grudgingly.

buildings.name: MonstrousCreatures
buildings.description: Building that produces monstrous creatures as well as generates research and influence.
buildings.flavour: Once a Fire Warrior has passed their Trial-By-Fire and proven themself, they are allowed to don the Her'ex'evre or Mantle of Heroes and pilot a battlesuit. Here, the iconic Tau machines are assembled by the Earth Caste, with Brachyuran technicians working on the fine internal mechanisms.

buildings.name: Vehicles
buildings.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates ore and influence.
buildings.flavour: Here the dour Earth caste craft the unique skimmer vehicles available to the Tau military. Over time, they assure you, they will be able to increase their capabilities.

upgrades.name: AdvancedTargetingSystem
upgrades.description: Battlesuit support system and vehicle upgrade that increases the ranged accuracy.
upgrades.flavour: An advanced targeting system assists the vehicle's gunner by identifying targets of particular value or danger and plotting fire plans to counter them.

upgrades.name: AutomatedRepairSystem
upgrades.description: Grants vehicles hitpoint restoration each turn.
upgrades.flavour: Tiny maintenance drones swarm over damaged systems to repair them in the midst of battle.

upgrades.name: Aircraft
upgrades.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as increases population limit and generates influence.
upgrades.flavour: The Air Castes slender limbs and hollow bones are so ill-suited to life on the ground that they are often called The Invisible Caste by planet-dwellers. Their nacelles are combined factories, hangars and living spacesthroughout holding technology that reduces the effects of Gladius Primes gravity on their delicate physiology.

upgrades.name: BlacksunFilter
upgrades.description: Increases the sight of vehicles, Ethereal and Pathfinders.
upgrades.flavour: This optical filtering suite allows vehicle sensors to target enemies at full efficiency and range, even during night fighting operations.

upgrades.name: BlastDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of flame and missile weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Area-effect weaponry has always been better placed to attack large infantry formations than hard targets like vehiclesbut the Earth Caste engineers have figured a way past that. By phase-shifting the energy components of explosive and incendiary weapons, they can ensure that at least some of their effect will leak past any shielding.

upgrades.name: BondingKnifeRitual
upgrades.description: Grants Fire Warriors, Pathfinders, XV25 Stealth Battlesuits, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits, XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuits and XV104 Riptide Battlesuits the ability to restore their morale.
upgrades.flavour: Many T'au groupings undergo the solemn and bloody ceremony known as the ta'lissera. Those teams that share this bond swear to support one another at all costs for the rest of their lives.

upgrades.name: BoltDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of burst and rail weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Even the finest Earth Caste technician cant assemble the components of their rail weapons by hand. But by entrusting this work to the tiny Brachyuran race and supplying them with miniaturised tools, they can shrink the scale and lower the fundamental deviation of any delicate operations, allowing for even more finerly tuned weaponry.

upgrades.name: BroadsideBattlesuit
upgrades.description: Heavily armoured infantry unit with long range weaponry.
upgrades.flavour: With deliberate strides, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits advance into optimum firing positions. Inside each of the heavily armoured battlesuits, holotargeting data dances across the retinas of the grim-faced pilot as he swings the suit's mighty guns towards the foe. Each Broadside is a walking gun battery, carrying either a twin-linked heavy rail rifle that can smash through Imperial power armour as though it were glass, or high-yield missile pods capable of wiping out swathes of enemy infantry in lethal explosions.

upgrades.name: BuilderDrone
upgrades.description: Drone unit that repairs units, clears tiles and founds new cities.
upgrades.flavour: Tau Drones are small hovering AI machines that fulfil a large variety of support functions. Unlike the Imperiums AIs, which are very simple and heavily constrained following the Men of Iron rebellion, Tau AIs are intelligent and operate independently. Builder Drones are an Earth Caste flavour.

upgrades.name: CityTier2
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.
upgrades.flavour: Once a city is a certain size, the Water Caste begin a diplomatic offensive to bring more civilians to the Waybombarding them with tailored propaganda of every form, from pamphlast drops to vid, rad and loudhailer broadcasts.

upgrades.name: Commander
upgrades.description: Jet pack hero unit that coordinates T'au metastrategies.
upgrades.flavour: The T'au Commander surges into battle in a blaze of firepower. Dynamic and determined, the Commander places every shot perfectly for maximum lethality. Veterans of hundreds of battles, each T'au Commander has the honour of piloting a battlesuit that represents the pinnacle of their race's military technology. The Commander's weapons are of the finest quality, often including special issue armaments that annihilate swathes of enemy infantry or tear battle tanks apart with a single shot.

upgrades.name: CityTier3
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.
upgrades.flavour: The thick-skinned Anthrazods are a slow-thinking race normally employed by the T'au for dangerous, heavy-duty activities like asteroid miningbut directed by the Demiurg and Earth Caste, they can produce city substructures and transport tunnels like no-one else, linking up distant sectors with ease.

upgrades.name: Construction
upgrades.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates ore, research and influence.
upgrades.flavour: The Brachyuran might not be suited to combatafter all, they mostly closely resemble crustaceans similar to tiny Terran crabsbut their compact form conceals a fierce technical intelligence, ideally suited to delicate construction. In this foundry, teams of Brachyuran can aid the Earth Caste in building structures, from the macro to the micro level.

upgrades.name: CounterfireDefenceSystem
upgrades.description: Battlesuit support system that increases the accuracy of overwatch attacks.
upgrades.flavour: These AI sensor suites incorporate predictive logic circuits to ensure that assaulting enemies are met with a withering hail of fire.

upgrades.name: CrisisBattlesuit
upgrades.description: Versatile jet pack infantry unit with short range weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Whether leaping into battle from low atmosphere or bounding toward the foe with their jump jets flaring, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits make for a truly inspiring sight. Heroes of the T'au Empire, these elite shasui have every high-tech weapon and support system at their disposal as they cut deep into the enemy lines with guns blazing. Salvoes of missiles and plasma fire tear heavy infantry to pieces and vaporise their armoured support. Gouts of superheated flame and whirring volleys of burst cannon fire sweep lesser enemies away like autumn leaves upon a gale.

upgrades.name: DisruptionPod
upgrades.description: Increases vehicle ranged damage reduction.
upgrades.flavour: A disruption pod throws out distorting images in both visual and magnetic spectra, making it hard to target the vehicle at range.

upgrades.name: Devilfish
upgrades.description: Skimmer tank unit that can transport infantry.
upgrades.flavour: Skimming swiftly across the battlefield, the TY7 Devilfish glides between smoking wrecks and blazing ruins, boosting over corpse-choked waterways and yawning ravines as it closes on its objective. A resilient and versatile transport, it is the Devilfish that affords the Fire caste the mobility they need to fight war in the T'au way. Formations of Devilfish bear Breacher Teams into the heart of the foe to execute the final stages of the Mont'ka strike. It is Devilfish that rapidly relocate Fire Warriors to new coordinates as part of each grand strategic manoeuvre, or punch through the enemy lines with guns blazing to extract Pathfinder Teams before they can be overwhelmed.

upgrades.name: EMPGrenade
upgrades.description: Grants Fire Warriors and Pathfinders the ability to throw anti-vehicle grenades.
upgrades.flavour: EMP grenades release electromagnetic pulses that damage vehicles.

upgrades.name: Ethereal
upgrades.description: Support hero unit that heals and compels troops to excel.
upgrades.flavour: Solemn and stern, members of the Ethereal caste direct their followers with a calm authority that cannot be denied. Each Ethereal moves in the eye of his own personal storm, an oasis of serenity amid the raging madness of war. Whether pacing steadily across the battlefield or borne upon the broad disc of a hover drone, the Ethereal issues measured commands to the T'au around him. Wherever his steady gaze alights, his followers fight harder than ever, compelled to excel in the eyes of one who utterly embodies the Greater Good.

upgrades.name: DroneController
upgrades.description: Battlesuit support system that increases the accuracy of adjacent drones.
upgrades.flavour: A Drone controller acts as an interface between a Fire caste operator and the AI battle programs of nearby drones.

upgrades.name: ExtraInfantryArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of infantry and monstrous creatures.
upgrades.flavour: Further studying the chitinous carapace of our Thraxian comrades has revealed substantial structural improvements we can make to the composition of our Cadre and Battle Suit armour.

upgrades.name: ExtraVehicleArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: Unlike the stagnant Techpriests of Mars, the Earth Caste are endlessly innovating and creating. Fiotak is the material that is the current peak of their creativity, a hard, ultra-dense, nano-crystalline metal alloy used sparingly on their finest creations.

upgrades.name: FlechetteDischarger
upgrades.description: Grants vehicles the ability to damage melee attackers.
upgrades.flavour: Powerful clusters of reactive charges are attached to the hulls of many T'au vehicles. If the enemy approaches, the clusters fire off vicious clouds of high velocity flechettes.

upgrades.name: ForTheGreaterGoodBonus
upgrades.description: Reduces the influence cost of For The Greater Good.
upgrades.flavour: When our Water Caste diplomats are in the field, they sometimes find it useful to take along our fungoid Charpactin allies, whose strobing ultraviolet communications have a sedative, almost hypnotic, effect on nearly all races.

upgrades.name: GunDrone
upgrades.description: Grants Fire Warriors, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits, XV25 Stealth Battlesuits, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits, Cadre Fireblade, Ethereal and Commander the ability to deploy temporary basic combat drones.
upgrades.flavour: Mounting underslung twin linked pulse carbines, Gun Drones provide their controller with additional covering fire.

upgrades.name: HammerOfWrath
upgrades.description: Grants XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuits, XV104 Riptide Battlesuits and KV128 Stormsurges the ability to perform more devastating attacks.
upgrades.flavour: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.

upgrades.name: Heroes
upgrades.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates food and influence.
upgrades.flavour: Commanders like ShadowSun and PureTide are rare individuals, raised up by the Ethereals to be representatives of all that is good and true about the Tau. So few are they that, when not deployed on campaigns, they are placed in stasis until the next time they are needed.

upgrades.name: HammerheadGunship
upgrades.description: Skimmer tank unit with versatile weaponry.
upgrades.flavour: Hammerhead Gunships glide into battle like predatory beasts. As they advance, their massive turret armaments traverse smoothly, railguns and ion cannons sweeping left and right as they hunt for targets. The moment a suitable victim presents itself, firing solutions are calculated in the blink of an eye. Power surges as gravitic stabilisers kick in with a bass hum and the Hammerheads loose the lethal fury of their arsenal upon the foe.

upgrades.name: KrootoxRider
upgrades.description: Sneaky infantry unit with both ranged and close combat capabilities.
upgrades.flavour: Surging from the undergrowth with their rifles blazing, the warriors of the Kroot Carnivore squads fall upon their victims with feral shrieks. In their midst lumber massive Krootoxes, gunners perched upon their backs as they direct sawing bursts of heavy fire into the foe.

upgrades.name: Housing
upgrades.description: Building that increases population limit.
upgrades.flavour: These sturdy housing units shelter the Taus greatest resourceits population of Tau and general workers. It is often the best-defended location next to the Etherealsbecause without workers and families to survive and rebuild, where is the worth in fighting?

upgrades.name: LasDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of fusion, ion, plasma and pulse weapons.
upgrades.flavour: As humanity has discovered to its cost, over and over, using radioactive materials in weaponry is always dangerous. Its reasonable to assume the Tau are cognisant of this, but choose to use the recently discovered Mortonium in their military technology anyway. Upon exposure to air, it rapidly decays into a massive burst of ionic energy that the Tau use.

upgrades.name: Loyalty
upgrades.description: Building that increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: This is a simple statue to AunVa, the Ethereal Supreme, showing him supporting the way, sculpted as a portal through which all the races of the galaxy flow. Embedded in its bone-white surface are a range of listening devices, to track the sentiment of the population and isolate dissident elements.

upgrades.name: MarkerDrone
upgrades.description: Grants Fire Warriors, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits, XV25 Stealth Battlesuits, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits, Cadre Fireblade, Ethereal and Commander the ability to deploy temporary drones that mark enemies for increased damage.
upgrades.flavour: Fitted with a markerlight and predictive tracking module, Marker Drones can paint targets and call in seeker missile strikes.

upgrades.name: Pathfinder
upgrades.description: Lightly armoured infantry unit with scouting capabilities and advanced drones.
upgrades.flavour: No image epitomises the essence of the Greater Good quite like a courageous Pathfinder holding his markerlight's beam upon a distant, crucial target, even as his own position is overrun by the foe. Indeed, the entire mission of the Pathfinders is a strategic embodiment of the T'au'va, for their key role is not to engage the enemy in person, but to optimise the abilities of their comrades so that they can strike with maximum effectiveness. To this end, Pathfinders carry markerlights and are regularly accompanied by a variety of highly specialised Drones that serve as fire support and drop-beacons.

upgrades.name: PhotonGrenade
upgrades.description: Grants Fire Warriors, Pathfinders and Cadre Fireblades the ability to throw blinding grenades.
upgrades.flavour: Defensive grenades, such as the photon grenades of the T'au, which emit multi-spectrum light and a sonic burst, have dual uses. When being charged, these are thrown to disorient the enemy attack; against shooting, theyre hurled to throw up clouds of concealing gas or smoke.

upgrades.name: PointDefenceTargetingRelay
upgrades.description: Grants vehicles increased overwatch damage against enemy units adjacent to other friendly units.
upgrades.flavour: Designed to provide superior covering fire for nearby Fire caste units, a point defense relay automatically targets and engages enemies that attempt to assault.

upgrades.name: MonstrousCreatures
upgrades.description: Building that produces monstrous creatures as well as generates research and influence.
upgrades.flavour: Once a Fire Warrior has passed their Trial-By-Fire and proven themself, they are allowed to don the Her'ex'evre or Mantle of Heroes and pilot a battlesuit. Here, the iconic Tau machines are assembled by the Earth Caste, with Brachyuran technicians working on the fine internal mechanisms.

upgrades.name: PurchaseOre
upgrades.description: Grants the ability to purchase ore with influence.
upgrades.flavour: Outside of Imperial oversight, the billion survivors of Gladius may be in constant threat of starvation, death or corruption, but they also have their first ever free time. Bring them to the Tau, and they may spend it scavenging ore and scrap from the fallen hives for you.

upgrades.name: PurchaseEnergy
upgrades.description: Grants the ability to purchase energy with influence.
upgrades.flavour: In the ruins of Gladius Prime, a billion people still live. Though war rages about them, though monstrosities erase their towns, they persistand those who recognize them, understand them and help them, will receive help in return.

upgrades.name: PurchaseFood
upgrades.description: Grants the ability to purchase food with influence.
upgrades.flavour: The billion survivors of Gladius hive cities live hand-to-mouthbut they survive. They dine on scavenged supplies, farmed crops, secret soylent vats, foraged ash clams and hunted canids. Convince them to join the Tau and they will share their feast.

upgrades.name: PurchaseResearch
upgrades.description: Grants the ability to purchase research with influence.
upgrades.flavour: The Imperiums technology may be archaic and strange, but the Earth Caste will never cease learning. If the Water Caste can persuade just a handful of Tech-priests to join our cause, their knowledge could supplement ourscould enable even more rapid advances in our technology.

upgrades.name: RiptideBattlesuit
upgrades.description: Heavily armoured jet pack monstrous creature unit with excellent fire support and a multipurpose nova reactor.
upgrades.flavour: Looming through the smoke and flames of the battlefield, XV104 Riptides are a truly terrifying sight. The teams' strides shake the ground, and their jump jets roar thunderously as they make long, dynamic bounds across the war zone. Foes quail in horror as the massive suits swings their heads in their direction, the pilots and their networked Als bringing their mighty arsenals to bear. With a rising whine, the Riptides' nova reactors power up, a momentary glow gathering around the battlesuits' jutting guns before they turn the world to fire and light.

upgrades.name: PurchasePopulation
upgrades.description: Grants the ability to purchase population with influence.
upgrades.flavour: Outside in the wastes, live the billion survivors of Gladius Prime. But the Tau doesnt discriminate against the guelashould you persuade them to join, they will surely contribute to our city and save this world.

upgrades.name: SensorSpines
upgrades.description: Grants vehicles move through cover.
upgrades.flavour: Sensor spines are used to feed data to an advanced ground-following flight control system, plotting safe courses through treacherous terrain that avoid traps and mines that might lie hidden from sight.

upgrades.name: RipykaVa
upgrades.description: Reduces the cooldown of the Commander's metastrategies.
upgrades.flavour: Commander Coldflame was famed for her subtlety, her ability to layer tactics on tactics but somehow inspire her troops to strive to match her strategic complexity. Some whispered, however, that she concerned herself too deeply with the Greater Good for a mere Fire Warrior

upgrades.name: SeekerMissile
upgrades.description: Grants vehicles and XV88 Broadside Battlesuits a missile weapon.
upgrades.flavour: Seeker missiles are one-shot weapons usually guided to their targets by markerlights, though they can be fired independently as well.

upgrades.name: SkyRayGunship
upgrades.description: Skimmer tank unit equipped with powerful missiles that excels in first strikes and against flyers.
upgrades.flavour: While the Hammerhead is a dynamic hunter, its sister gunship the TX78 Sky Ray is a far more sinister killer. Mounting a complement of seeker missiles beneath its upswept ordnance racks, the Sky Ray typically lurks behind the main T'au advance, remaining mute and concealed until the moment comes to strike. The Sky Ray often fulfils a supporting role, and its ballistic arsenal can be called in by any T'au with a markerlight to carry out a remote strike on a sufficiently valuable target.

upgrades.name: ShieldGenerator
upgrades.description: Battlesuit support system that grants invulnerable damage reduction.
upgrades.flavour: This generator projects a choesive energy field capable of protecting the bearer from heavy ordnance and anti-tank weapons fire.

upgrades.name: StealthBattlesuit
upgrades.description: Jet pack infantry unit that specializes in infiltration and anti-armour.
upgrades.flavour: For some foes, the only hint of danger is a slight sensor-ghost, or the unnerving feeling of being watched. For others there is no warning at all, before the world lights up with chattering burst cannons and hissing fusion blasters. Flickering out from amid their camouflage fields come the T'au Stealth Suits, their point-blank salvoes chopping enemy infantry to steaming offal and blowing their armoured vehicles sky high.

upgrades.name: Stormsurge
upgrades.description: Gargantuan creature with phenomenal firepower that is equally lethal in attack and defence.
upgrades.flavour: The earth shakes with the approach of the towering KV128 Stormsurge. Mag-lifted into battle by modified Manta Missile Destroyers, these titanic walking tanks serve as mobile strongpoints with enough firepower to obliterate entire formations of the foe. Once he has the enemy in his sights, the Stormsurge's pilot fires stabilising anchors, locking the enormous ballistic suit to the ground while the gunner diverts all power to its apocalyptic arsenal of weaponry.

upgrades.name: SubversionBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the loyalty penalty of Subvert City.
upgrades.flavour: Whilst conducting oppositional research, the Tau found the phrase think like your foe in a human military textbook. The Water Caste have taken it to heart and thoroughly investigate the unfulfilled needs and desires of a given settlementwhether shivering Necron slaves or squig-hungry Ork boysbefore fomenting rebellion.

upgrades.name: StimulantInjector
upgrades.description: Battlesuit support system that increases feel no pain damage reduction.
upgrades.flavour: The battlesuit is fitted with an advanced life-support system that is able to flood the warrior's system with analgesic drugs and life-sustaining stimulants should he become wounded.

upgrades.name: SunSharkBomber
upgrades.description: Flying bomber unit that auto-marks enemies for increased damage and deploys interceptor drones.
upgrades.flavour: As the Sun Shark bomber soars into battle, its pulse bomb generator flares to life, the charge glowing brighter and brighter until it sears the eyes like a miniature star. Guided by holosuite targeters, the Sun Shark's pilot grimly holds his course through a hail of enemy flak, waiting to discharge his pulse bomb at the optimum moment. Even as the Sun Shark peels away into the clouds once more, a vast fireball engulfs the enemy below, the blazing flare erasing those who will not embrace the Greater Good.

upgrades.name: ShieldDrone
upgrades.description: Grants Fire Warriors, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits, XV25 Stealth Battlesuits, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits, Cadre Fireblade, Ethereal and Commander the ability to deploy temporary drones that shield allies.
upgrades.flavour: Projecting a powerful counter-ballistic force field, Shield Drones protect their operators from harm.

upgrades.name: TidewallGunrig
upgrades.description: Grants Builder Drones the ability to construct a heavily armed fortification that can be moved by transporting troops.
upgrades.flavour: With its in-built rail weaponry, the Tidewall Gunrig provides the firepower to deal with heavy enemy assault units or advancing ranks of armour. Manned by hard-eyed Fire Warriors, these mobile turrets mount devastating railguns that are more than capable of ripping apart enemy tanks or monstrous beasts with volleys of hyper-sonic rounds.

upgrades.name: TacticalSupportTurret
upgrades.description: Grants Fire Warriors an additional weapon when stationary.
upgrades.flavour: Carried in racks along the flanks of Orca Dropships, tactical support turrets are automated defence batteries that provide support for Fire Warrior Strike Teams. These armoured turrets plummet into battle and deploy as fixed positions to add their firepower to the fight. Each turret is programmed to self-destruct should its sensors register the possibility of capture or tampering. This feature means that the T'au's superior weaponry can never be turned upon them by their enemies.

upgrades.name: Vehicles
upgrades.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates ore and influence.
upgrades.flavour: Here the dour Earth caste craft the unique skimmer vehicles available to the Tau military. Over time, they assure you, they will be able to increase their capabilities.

upgrades.name: UtopiaBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the loyalty bonus from new building types.
upgrades.flavour: The ideal Tau city is an example to all others, displaying a perfect balance of the various castes of the Tau race with their client and auxiliary races, all living in harmony.

upgrades.name: VelocityTracker
upgrades.description: Battlesuit support system that increases the ranged accuracy against flyers.
upgrades.flavour: These advanced motion-detecting and heat-seeking sensor systems allow pilots to track the movements of airborne targets.

upgrades.name: VectoredRetroThrusters
upgrades.description: Battlesuit support system that increases movement and allows the unit to ignore enemy zone of control.
upgrades.flavour: The warrior's battlesuit is equipped with supplemental thruster nozzles, allowing him a degree of additional manoeuvrability.
